title: Puerto Rico OSHA Energy Industry Worker Deaths (Occupational Safety And Health Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Puerto Rico public records law, I hereby request the following records:

OSHA's reports of fatalities for CY17-24 shows no worker deaths in Puerto Rico during the year 2024. However, local reports show that multiple electrical workers have died in 2024: 
https://www.metro.pr/noticias/2024/05/23/fallece-empleado-de-luma-tras-descarga-electrica/
https://wapa.tv/noticias/locales/fallece-empleado-de-luma-tras-ser-picado-por-abejas-y-caer-al-vac-o-en/article_372b518e-7d22-11ef-839a-67ceb10ee5a4.html

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, emails, text messages and attachments exchanged between OSHA personnel in charge of tracking worker fatalities and LUMA Energy personnel in charge of reporting workplace fatalities. 

To aid in your search, emails from LUMA likely are from email addresses that end in @lumapr.com 

2) Documents, images, reports, photographs, charts, and graphs surging from any investigations or inspections concerning workplace deaths within Puerto Rico's energy industry. 

It is likely that documents relating to this FOIA will be found at either Puerto Rico Occupational Safety and Health Administration (PR OSHA) or the New York City Regional Office.

Keywords: "LUMA Energy," "LUMA," and "Puerto Rico Energy"

This request is for all records produced from January 1, 2023 to the time this request is processed. Please send me any records produced on a rolling basis.

This request is not made for commercial purposes. Any documents produced from this request  will be used in the course of reporting for Heavy Weather, an independent newsletter about Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: Puerto Rico OSHA Energy Industry Worker Deaths (Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), Region II: New York)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OSHA's reports of fatalities for CY17-24 shows no worker deaths in Puerto Rico during the year 2024. However, local reports show that multiple electrical workers have died in 2024: 
https://www.metro.pr/noticias/2024/05/23/fallece-empleado-de-luma-tras-descarga-electrica/
https://wapa.tv/noticias/locales/fallece-empleado-de-luma-tras-ser-picado-por-abejas-y-caer-al-vac-o-en/article_372b518e-7d22-11ef-839a-67ceb10ee5a4.html

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, emails, text messages and attachments exchanged between OSHA personnel in charge of tracking worker fatalities and LUMA Energy personnel in charge of reporting workplace fatalities. 

To aid in your search, emails from LUMA likely are from email addresses that end in @lumapr.com 

2) Documents, images, reports, photographs, charts, and graphs surging from any investigations or inspections concerning workplace deaths within Puerto Rico's energy industry. 

It is likely that documents relating to this FOIA will be found at either Puerto Rico Occupational Safety and Health Administration (PR OSHA) or the New York City Regional Office.

Keywords: "LUMA Energy," "LUMA," and "Puerto Rico Energy"

This request is for all records produced from January 1, 2023 to the time this request is processed. Please send me any records produced on a rolling basis.

This request is not made for commercial purposes. Any documents produced from this request  will be used in the course of reporting for Heavy Weather, an independent newsletter about Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco
